From: Mike Clark <mike@...>
> >I have already implemented this with JUnit by making the 
> >TestMessenger TestCase a MessengerLister.  After I add a message I 
> >sleep until a response is supplied. I then wake up (or time out for 
> >failure) and test if this is the correct response to assert if the 
> >test failed or passed. 
> >
> 
> Sounds like a reasonable integration test.  That's generally the 
> approach I take when faced with testing asynchronous messaging end-to-end.
> 
> Mike

Also, you can look at mocking your messenger layer. Whenever, I've done asynch testing, I found a way to make the testing synchronouse using a mock layer. This was ideal for simulating odd messaging behavior that could not be easily replicated asynchronously.
